subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Night Photography with a 35mm
author: Elabeth
full_text:
LOL, not as far as I know, but then I'm the one asking because I'm not
getting any results so what do I know?

It generates a bunch of noise on it's own so I wouldn't think any more
would be necessary. It was my understanding that the messages come
through "whomever" manipulating the radio voices as it rapidly goes
from station to station.  I'm just recording what comes through the
radio.

Am I leaving out some important step?

~Elabeth

On Mon, Aug 11, 2008 at 10:27 PM, Chad Wiggins <cawiggins78@...> wrote:
> So, you don't think white noise is necessary? When you hook it up to the
> digital recorder, do you also run a line in for a mic?
>

> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Night Photography with a 35mm
>
